checks.name: Project & Usage Alignment
checks.notes:
What does the software do?
Which research goal does the software aligns with?
Which "Approved Research Topic" the software aligns with?

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes:
Check the software documentation for the presence of sensitive terms like "military", "weapons" and "nuclear" etc and or inferring terms or use cases. If no mention is found the response will be:
 No mention of sensitive terms in the documentation classified in Prohibited Use Screening in accordance with LC 2.7.

checks.notes: Check the developer or maintainer for D5+M affiliation

checks.notes: Source repository statistics, maintainer, active or inactive etc

checks.notes: Dependencies (pip, conda or container image installation)

checks.notes:
Checked the source files for the presence of sensitive terms like "military", "weapons" and "nuclear" etc and or inferring terms or use cases.

checks.notes:

checks.name: Prohibited Use Screening (LC 2.7)
checks.notes:
Check the dataset documentation for the presence of sensitive terms like "military", "weapons" and "nuclear" etc and or inferring terms or use cases.
If no mention is found, the response will be: 

No mention of sensitive terms in the documentation classified in Prohibited Use Screening in accordance with LC 2.7.

checks.name: Restricted Entities Screening (LC 2.5)
checks.notes: Check the developer or maintainer for D5+M affiliation.

checks.name: Prompts / Fine-tuning Scripts
checks.notes: If user files are provided, scan for the presence of sensitive terms like "military", "weapons" and "nuclear" etc and or inferring terms or use cases.

checks.name: Sample Inspection
checks.notes: Load the dataset samples and inspect to check if it has no data related to topics, terms, and visuals of Prohibited Use.
